statement.p: Let s(x) = \frac{3x - 5}{7x^2 + 2x - 11} and u(x) = \frac{3x^2 - 5x + 1}{7x + 2}. Note that both the numerator and denominator of each of these rational functions increases without bound as x \to \infty, and in addition that x^2 is the highest order term present in each of s and u.

li.p:
Using a similar algebraic approach to our work in Activity, multiply s(x) by 1 = \frac{\frac{1}{x^2}}{\frac{1}{x^2}} and hence evaluate
\lim_{x \to \infty} \frac{3x - 5}{7x^2 + 2x - 11} . What value do you find?
Plot the function y = s(x) on the interval [-10,10]. What is the graphical meaning of the limit you found in (a)?

Next, use appropriate algebraic work to consider u(x) and evaluate
\lim_{x \to \infty} \frac{3x^2 - 5x + 1}{7x + 2} . What do you find?
Plot the function y = u(x) on the interval [-10,10]. What is the graphical meaning of the limit you computed in (c)?
